org.jpws.pwslib.global

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.global.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of useful routines for various purposes. Includes a ready-to-use instance of a cryptographical random generator (CrytoRandom).

    • Constructor Summary

      • bytesToHex

        public static java.lang.String bytesToHex(byte[] b,
                          int offset,
                          int length)
        Converts a byte array to a hexadecimal string. Conversion starts at byte offset and continues for length bytes.
        Parameters:
        b - the array to be converted.
        offset - the start offset within b.
        length - the number of bytes to convert.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the byte array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if offset and length are misplaced

        Parameters:

        dest - the destination byte array

        offs - the start offset in dest

      • readUIntLittle

                  int offs)
        Reads an unsigned 4-byte integer value from a byte array in a Little-Endian manner (least significant stored first). The returned value is a long integer.
        Parameters:
        b - the source byte array
        offs - the start offset in dest
        Returns:
        long unsigned 32-bit integer as read from the byte sequence
        Since:

      • getByteArray

        public static byte[] getByteArray(char[] carr)
        Transforms a char array into a byte array by sequentially writing characters. Each char is stored in Little-Endian manner as unsigned short integer value in the range 0..65535.
        Parameters:
        carr - the source char array
        Returns:
        byte array, the transformed state of the parameter with double length of the parameter

      • equalArrays

        public static boolean equalArrays(byte[] a,
                  byte[] b)
        Whether two byte arrays have equal contents.
        Parameters:
        a - first byte array to compare
        b - second byte array to compare
        Returns:
        true if and only if a) a and b have the same length, and b) for all indices i for 0 to length holds a[i] == b[i]

      • equalArrays

        public static boolean equalArrays(byte[] a,
                  byte[] b,
                  int offset)
        Whether two byte arrays have equal contents in a specified section.
        Parameters:
        a - first byte array to compare
        b - second byte array to compare (sectional element)
        offset - offset in b where to start comparison
        Returns:
        true if and only if 1) b has a minimum length of a.length + offset, and 2) content of a equals b[ offset..offset+a.length ]
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • blockedBuffer

        public static byte[] blockedBuffer(byte[] b,
                   int blocksize,
                   int minBlocks)
        Returns the content of the parameter byte array b in a second byte array r whose length is at least as large as b but an integer multiple of blocksize. The length difference of r and b is less than blocksize except when minBlocks arranges a greater length. Additional content is assigned zero values.
        Parameters:
        b - source byte array to reflect
        blocksize - "root" value of the resulting array's length
        minBlocks - the minimum number of blocks allocated for the resulting array
        Returns:
        a normalised byte array with the content of b

      • arraycopy

        public static byte[] arraycopy(byte[] b,
               int start,
               int length)
        Returns a copy of the parameter byte array of the given length. The result will be identical, a shortage or a prolongation of the parameter value, depending on the length setting.
        Parameters:
        b - data source
        start - offset in b
        length - length in b
        Returns:
        array segment of b

      • arraycopy

        public static byte[] arraycopy(byte[] b,
               int length)
        Returns a copy of the parameter byte array of the given length. The result will be identical, a shortage or a prolongation of the parameter value, depending on the length setting.
        Parameters:
        b - data source
        length - length in b
        Returns:
        array segment within b from start offset 0

      • bytesToLittleEndian

        public static void bytesToLittleEndian(byte[] src)
        Converts an array from the native big-endian order to the little-endian order used by PasswordSafe. The array is transformed in-place.
        Parameters:
        src - the array to be byte-swapped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array length is zero or not a multiple of four bytes.

      • fingerPrint

        public static byte[] fingerPrint(byte[] buffer)
        Returns a SHA-256 fingerprint value of the parameter byte buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - data to digest
        Returns:
        SHA256 digest
        Since:
        0-3-0, 2-1-0 extended to SHA-256 (was SHA-1)

      • substituteText

        public static java.lang.String substituteText(java.lang.String text,
                              java.lang.String token,
                              java.lang.String substitute)
        Renders a string based on text where any occurence of token is replaced by substitute. Replace takes place iteratively until not further occurence exists.
        Returns:
        String the result of transformation; null if any of the parameters is null
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • substituteTextS

        public static java.lang.String substituteTextS(java.lang.String text,
                               java.lang.String token,
                               java.lang.String substitute)
        Renders a string based on text where the first occurrence of token is replaced by substitute.
        (Returns the original if any of the parameters is null or length or token is zero.)
        Returns:
        String the result of substitute; null if any of the parameters is null
        Since:
        0-4-0

      • XOR_buffers

        public static final byte[] XOR_buffers(byte[] a,
                 byte[] b)
        Returns a byte array of same length as the input buffers where the result has XORed each ordinal position in both arrays (a XOR b).
        Parameters:
        a - input byte array (same length as b)
        b - input byte array (same length as a)
        Returns:
        XOR-ed a and b
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a and b have differing length
        Since:
        2-0-0

        public static java.lang.String dottedNumber(long value)
        Returns a string representation of the parameter long integer value including decimal separation signs (after VM default locale).
        Parameters:
        value - long integer
        Returns:
        dotted text representation
        Since:
        2-0-0

      • printableString

        public static java.lang.String printableString(java.lang.String s)
        Returns a string which is a copy of the parameter string where all ISO-controll characters are replaced by '%' characters.
        Parameters:
        s - input string
        Returns:
        mutated (printable) string version
        Since:

      • makeFileURL

        public static java.net.URL makeFileURL(java.lang.String filepath)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a URL object constructed from the given file path. This method first attempts to interpret filepath as a regular URL nominator. If this fails it attempts to see filepath as a local file path nominator and returns a "file:" protocol URL. Local filepaths get canonized.
        Parameters:
        filepath -
        Returns:
        URL for parameter file path
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if filepath is malformed
        java.io.IOException - if some IO error occurs

      • equalArrays

        public static boolean equalArrays(char[] a,
                  char[] b)
        Whether two character arrays have equal contents.
        Parameters:
        a - first char array to compare
        b - second char array to compare
        Returns:
        true if and only if a) a and b have the same length, and b) for all indices i for 0 to length holds a[i] == b[i]

      • clearedSymbolSet

        public static char[] clearedSymbolSet(char[] ownSymbols)
        Returns an array of characters with 2 features: a) elements are naturally sorted, b) each element appears only once.
        Parameters:
        ownSymbols - char[] any sequence of characters
        Returns:
        char[] sorted set of characters

      • excludeCharset

        public static char[] excludeCharset(char[] symbols,
                    char[] exc)
        Character set subtraction. Returns an array of characters with 2 features: a) elements are also element in "symbols", b) elements are not elements in "exc". The sorting of elements is the same as in "symbols".
        Parameters:
        symbols - char[] any sequence of characters
        exc - char[] characters to be excluded from symbols
        Returns:
        char[] character set consisting of "symbols" subtracted by all occurrences of characters in "exc"
